headline: How Church & Dwight’s (CHD) Margin and EPS Outlook Could Reshape Its Investment Narrative
summary: In late January 2026, Church & Dwight reported stronger-than-expected Q4 2025 adjusted EPS, supported by steady demand across both value and premium household and personal care products, and outlined expectations for further margin expansion, volume-led organic sales growth, and adjusted EPS growth in 2026. What stands out is management’s confidence that both cost efficiency gains and sustained consumer demand can work together to support higher profitability while still growing volumes...
